column2: IPA: [jɪnʲɪˈsʲejsk]) is a town in Krasnoyarsk Krai
column4: located on the Yenisei River. Population: 18

column1: Yeniseysk was founded in 1619 as a stockaded town—the first town on the Yenisei River. It played an important role in Russian colonization of East Siberia in the 17th–18th centuries. Its location is due to the Siberian River Routes from the Urals
column3: up the Ket River and over a portage to Yeniseysk and from there to the Yenisei basin. It became less important due to road and rail building further south. Its old town is included by the Russian government in the country's tentative World Heritage List.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Yeniseysk serves as the administrative center of Yeniseysky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column4: it is incorporated separately as the krai town of Yeniseysk—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the krai town of Yeniseysk is incorporated as Yeniseysk Urban Okrug.

column1: The town is served by the Yeniseysk Airport.
Yeniseysk has a subarctic climate (Köppen climate classification Dfc)
column5: and is somewhat higher in summer than at other times of the year. Being less affected by the dry Siberian High in winter than areas farther east
column6: Yeniseysk has reliably high snowfall by Siberian standards with a total of 207.8 millimetres (8.18 in) of precipitation between October and April
column7: although on average not very high amounts compared to cold climates close to oceans.
